mobs.long_desc: A muscular Frakati guard stands here, eyeing you down.
mobs.desc: Standing here with his head held high, this man has great pride in his tribe. He is well equipped and is ready to fight on command.  He is not the violent type but is willing to do anything to save his fellow Frakati.

mobs.keywords: guard guardian frakati muscular chief frakatichief
mobs.long_desc: The Chief Frakati guard stands here, quietly waiting.
mobs.desc: This tall guard is the chief among the other guards, shown by his large sword and bulging muscles.  His eyes are focused on you as you glance over at him, and he is ready to strike at any time.

mobs.long_desc: A young man stoops low here, looking as if he hasn't eaten in days.
mobs.desc: You can barely make out this man's face behind all the camouflage.  He leans here against a tree, with a large spear in his hand.  He has been hunting for quite some time and has mastered this difficult art.

mobs.long_desc: A figure in the shade of the canopy attempts to hide behind a tree here!
mobs.desc: As he mistakenly makes eye contact with you he jumps behind a tree.  Afraid that you are one of the feared orcs that have been known to travel these woods. He is very young and has probably not travelled these woods often.

mobs.long_desc: A large, rough-skinned combatant towers here, eyes focused on you.
mobs.desc: He slowly scans the area, eager to test his newly learned skills.  A wide back and giant shoulders easily make this warrior a great wrestler.

mobs.long_desc: A tired Frakati farmer works the land here.
mobs.desc: This small man has been working on this farm for quite some time.  He stands here with his hoe in his hand, getting the soil ready for a hopeful new year.

mobs.long_desc: A small dog lays here behind a young oak tree
mobs.desc: This small dog hides here in the shade, waiting for someone to play with.  The excited look on his face shows that he hasn't seen any outsiders for quite some time.

mobs.long_desc: The fat Frakati chef stands here, dishing out plates of pork.
mobs.desc: This short Frakati citizen has a huge smile on his face at all times.  He has been the Frakati chef for quite a long time, much to the delite of the warriors of the reservation.  Judging by his large gut, he eats as much food as he gives out.

mobs.long_desc: A common Frakati woman scurries about here, completely ignoring you.
mobs.desc: Her eyes hit yours as you stare down the short Frakati commoner.  She quickly looks away and attempts to complete the tasks that need to be finished before sunset.

mobs.long_desc: A powerful Frakati warrior stands here, guarding the coffin.
mobs.desc: Standing over seven feet tall, he is not only the tallest, but the most built Frakati you've seen in this Reservation.  He is equipped with a dark green axe, and thick bodyarmor.  He stands here defiantly watching over the corpse of Injoni Rif.

mobs.long_desc: The old Frakati weaponsmith stands here, behind his work table.
mobs.desc: This large old man has scars all over his arms and hands.  He had spent quite a bit of his earlier years fighting off orcs and hunting dinner for the village. He stands here ready to assist any Frakati who needs their weapons adjusted.

mobs.long_desc: A lonesome woman floats here, casting rubbish into the air.
mobs.desc: This sneaky sorcerer stands here trying to stay as concealed as possible.  The dark cloak which covers her body radiates magic as it glows a deep black color.

mobs.long_desc: A common Frakati man goes about his daily business.
mobs.desc: A set of old cotton clothes identifies this man as an average hard-working frakati.  He walks peacefully through the area trying to keep up on his daily work.

mobs.long_desc: The short Frakati armorsmith is hard at work here.
mobs.desc: The small Frakati woman that runs this shop has mastered the art of armor creation.  She has been working on the steel and wooden breastplates for quite some time, and has saved quite a few Frakati's lives during her lifetime.

mobs.long_desc: The strange medicine man is organizing his herbs here.
mobs.desc: The dirty old man that works behind a small counter here looks and acts like he's lost his mind.  He runs back and forth from the herb cabinet unlocking and then relocking it everytime he needs something from inside.

mobs.long_desc: Rix, the owner of this magic shop, floats here in the shadows.
mobs.desc: You barely catch of glimpse of this dark man as the small candle in the corner of the room casts a weak ray of light on him.  He is hard at work here creating and casting all sorts of spells.

mobs.long_desc: The old Frakati leader stands here, lurched over his large table.
mobs.desc: This kin to the great Injoni Rif has certainly received many of his physical traits.  Being well over six feet tall, he towers over all the other guards and fellow villagers.  Serving his ancestors well, this old warrior has built and preserved as much of the reservation as he could.  With scars all over his body, he has certainly spent his time on the battlefield, but now rules his land from this secret hall.

mobs.long_desc: A large Frakati warrior stands here, watching your every move.
mobs.desc: This rough looking Frakati has been trained by the best of soldiers to take care of and defend the village.  All the Frakati warriors have been trained, or have watched the Frakati Leader in action, and have all learned his skills and tactics of fighting.  Although unequipped, this warrior is sure to give any challanger a fight for his life.

mobs.long_desc: A strong warrior stands here, watching the area thoroughly.
mobs.desc: This young yet strong warrior stands a mere five feet tall, but surely can take care of any evil travellers who could have made their way into the villiage. He is unequipped, but his stern look ensures that he is quite the deadly warrior.

mobs.long_desc: A tall Frakati warrior stands here, eyeing the area down.
mobs.desc: This well-built frakati soldier has been scouting the area for quite some time. His eyes scour the area in search of any evil trespasser who made it past the guards surround the village.

mobs.long_desc: A young Frakati woman stands here, quietly yawning.
mobs.desc: Stretched out on her small bed, she lies here dreaming of venturing out of the reservation and into a world of open land filled with lakes and rivers everywhere.

mobs.long_desc: A tired Frakati warrior stands here, watching the area.
mobs.desc: This young warrior has not yet been in a real battle, but has trained for it over and over again.  He stands here tall and wide, ready to help all those in the village from any evil outsider .

mobs.long_desc: A tired Frakati hunter stands here, slowly eyeing you down.
mobs.desc: This skilled hunter is completely camouflaged from head to toe.  His face has been painted with an array of brown, greens, and blacks to disguise him with the surrounding forest.

mobs.long_desc: An old man stands here, painting a large plank.
mobs.desc: This old man has incredibly white hair.  His tired look suggests that he has been hard at working keeping his old reservation as hidden as possible.  His own smell of age along with the strong paint he works with makes this area quite stinky.

mobs.long_desc: An old woman stands here, peacefully painting on the table.
mobs.desc: This old woman has served her time as a laborer for the reservation which she spent her whole life in.  She peacefully works on the planks here, painting slowly, trying to relax and void out the world.

mobs.long_desc: An old woman sits here, knitting up a small outfit.
mobs.desc: Thick wrinkles cover the old face of this tired woman.  She sits here calmly around the wooden table getting as much of the villages clothing needs done as her little hands allow her.

mobs.long_desc: An old man sits peacefully, resting his tired hands.
mobs.desc: Deep brown eyes and a soft smile gives this old man a peaceful look.  He was once a brutal frakati warrior, but now spends his time with the other older frakati getting the villages outfits and supplies made.  He sits around the small trying to save up some energy to start his work again.

mobs.long_desc: A young man stands here, behind a thick stack of papers.
mobs.desc: Two large eyes dart from paper to paper as this young researcher tries to find the right map.  Being one of the most overworked people in the reservation, he hides his stress under a set of large bifocals.  Along with the help of his partner, the Frakatis chances of venturing into neighboring land has been greatly increased thanks too their hard work.

mobs.long_desc: A short man stands here looking at a small map.
mobs.desc: This short man has been looking through this jumble of papers for quite some time.  He himself has ventured outside the reservation only once, and has felt the danger of the neighboring land.  He knows how important it is for the frakati to find a nearby village, but also wants to keep the reservation as safe and hidden as possible .

mobs.long_desc: A hairy monkey is here, searching for food.
mobs.desc: This large monkey is quite old, and seems to know this land very well.  He is completely brown with a large white belly, which seems to be as full as it can get.  He peacefully stands here looking for a bite to eat.

mobs.long_desc: A small parrot rests here on the branches of a birch tree.
mobs.desc: This amazing animal's feathers are full of reds and blues which make it stand out in this thick forest.  His eyes remain quite alert, ready to take off at any unexpected movement around him.

mobs.long_desc: A camouflaged snake hides here, trying to find dinner.
mobs.desc: This young tree snake has slowly evolved over the years into a sneaky green and brown ground and tree dweller.  It lays here, gaining warmth from the sun's rays which have made there way through the canopy here.

mobs.long_desc: An enormous guard stands here, blocking the entrance to the north.
mobs.desc: This extremely large guard stands here in an alert stance, blocking the sleeping quarters to the north.  He is unquipped but his very large hands and arms, and his huge frame make him out to be a most deadly opponent.

objects.ground: A light, fluffy ring of moisture is floating here, raining upon the ground below.

extras.text: Almost insubstantial, this moist little bracelet is made of fluffy cumulus clouds.  It drips continuously, never seeming to run out of water.  When placed on the wrist, it magically resizes itself to fit, whether it be for arms slender of massive.

objects.ground: A well is here, gushing forth water from within the earth.

extras.text: This small stone well provides all the reservation with a fresh supply of much needed water.  The fresh clear look of the water inside ensures that it is as clean as an all-natural spring.

objects.ground: A key with the head of a leaf is fluttering here in the breeze.

extras.text: This small key is entirely made of wood and smells of rich sap.  Its hard surface will ensure it a long life, and seems to be well-crafted based on its detailed engravings .

objects.ground: Notes manifest into a slender key here, playing a tune you know not.
A key of platinum rests here, having fallen out of its owner's pocket.

extras.text: This small hard key is made from the only platinum found around these parts. The wise Frakati medicine man has crafted it himself, judging by the rugged twists and turns of the base.

objects.ground: An unfinished object is lying here.
A cupboard of maple wood hangs here from the wall.
An old piece of paper tumbles in the breeze.

extras.text: Ok, My family's ancient pizza receipe. Take garlic put it on some bread and add tomato sauce and viola!

objects.ground: A pool in the shape of a rose lies here, letters embossed on the side.

extras.text: The fountain seems vaguely out of place here, standing unattended in the middle of a woodland to which not many visit. However, you begin to view it as more of a tribute, or commemoration, than just a pool of water. Further examination reveals the following phrase on the side: TO THE HOUSE OF SHALDYR, ZAREN AND DARAN

objects.ground: There is a LARGE sign hanging from a tree.

extras.text: To all those wishing to enter Please be advised that the path you are travelling on comes to a dead end. The forest is private land and cannot be travelled into for any reason. If you are caught on these properties you will be apprehended and action will be taken. Thanks

objects.ground: A small Frakati longsword lies here in the dirt.

extras.text: This small sword is made out of the hardest steel in the Frakati land.  The grip is made of strong oak, and the razor-sharp blade is sure to take care of any problem that could arise.

objects.ground: A long wooden spear is lying here.

extras.text: This small spear is made entirely of wood, and appears to be used soley for hunting purposes.  The arrowhead at the tip of the spear seems to be quite dull, showing signs of being used quite often .

objects.ground: An enormous wooden table stretches thirty feet long.

extras.text: This enormous table is one of the most colorful you have ever seen.  The dried paint which has dripped off the pieces the elder Frakati have been working on. This continuous splatter of paint has made is full greens and browns that make up a very unique design.

objects.ground: A dusty oak coffin rests here in the middle of the tree.

extras.text: Now dusty with age, the dark oak coffin gleams in the few spots that a continuous breeze blows upon.  Based on the incredible details on the engravings of the coffin, this man must have been a very important person all throughout the Frakati's existance.

Wrapped in some sort of paper material, the oldest and first Frakati lies here in silent peace.  This man lead his people through the thick woods of the surrounding land, and started the first Frakati settlement.  A strong and powerful warrior, the corpse of this long deceased hero lies here, eternally guarded by the largest Frakati warrior you've ever seen.

objects.ground: The decayed corpse of Injoni Rif lies here.

extras.text: Wrapped in some sort of paper material, the oldest and first Frakati lies here in silent peace.  This man lead his people through the thick woods of the surrounding land, and started the first Frakati settlement.  A strong and powerful warrior, the corpse of this long deceased hero lies here, eternally guarded by the largest Frakati warrior you've ever seen.

objects.ground: A long shiny broadsword lies here.

extras.text: This enormous steel sword gleams brightly as you look down upon it.  Its incredibly long and sharp blade is ready to cut through anything that comes in its way.  At the bottom, just above the grip, the words Injoni Rif are forged into the thick steel.

objects.ground: A small green and yellow mushroom grows here.

extras.text: This small mushroom is certainly one of a kind.  Its green stem and yellow cap, give this mushroom a very strange look.  Although it appears to be quite extra-ordinary, it is very edible.

objects.ground: A dark green axe lies here on the ground.

extras.text: This sacred axe was made out of the hardest and rarest trees of all the Frakati land.  Its shiny surface and deep colors make it gleem like an emerald.  The possesor of this sword must truly be important to the Frakati.

objects.ground: A set of sacred Frakati body armor lies here on the ground.

extras.text: This dark set of armor glows hazy green as you look at it.  Made from the hardest tree trunk in the Frakati land, this armor is almost incapable of being damaged by any steel or iron weapons.

objects.ground: A small Frakati shortsword lies here.

extras.text: This small steel sword has been sharpened as much as it possibly can.  The leather grip provides a good grip, and the light weight ensures that almost any Frakati could use it to slay an orc at anytime.

objects.ground: A small double bladed axe lies here.

extras.text: This small but deadly axe has been forged out of a dark shiny steel metal. The two sharp blades that point in opposite directions are sure to take out any obstacle thrown in its way.

objects.ground: A longsword with a broken blade lies here.

extras.text: This steel weapon has the most important part of it broken off, the blade! Large scrapes and scars show that this now useless weapon took quite a beating before it was broken

objects.ground: A small shortsword with a weak blade lies here.

extras.text: This small Frakati sword has been withered down to a dull point.  The small leather grip located at the bottom has also become worn away, but still provides ample leverage.  This blade is certainly in need of a sharpening

objects.ground: A small steel dagger lies here.

extras.text: This short steel dagger has an incredibly deadly point at its tip.  The small leather grip which was at the base of the dagger has worn completely away, and is in much need of a new one.

objects.ground: A solid oak breastplate lies here on the ground.

extras.text: This dark brown wooden breastplate has been carved out of the hard wood from the trunk of an oak tree.  The 3 inches of protection it provides is sure to defy and sharp steel or iron weapons.

objects.ground: A small wooden shield is here lying on the ground.

extras.text: This thick mahogony shield you now look at is securly wrapped with strong rope to ensure its longevity on the battlefield.  The small ensignia of the Frakati has been carved into the inside of this small defensive shield.

objects.ground: An old beat up shield lies here.

extras.text: This old shield has endured more than its share of slashes and pierces during its time on the battlefield.  The deep indentures on the front of this shield show that the warrior who used it must have been through some tough times.

objects.ground: A wooden breastplate with a crack in it lies on the ground here.

extras.text: A large crack the size of your fist destroys any value this wooden breastplate could have.  Its otherwise flawless structure shows that a freak accident must have put this plate out of the hands of a Frakati soldier.

objects.ground: A strong herbal potion lies here on the ground.

extras.text: This old and small potion has been brewed directly from the freshest Frakati plants around.  The green particles you see in the potion shows signs that this herb is not only one of the healing kind, but a strong one.

objects.ground: A dark herbal potion lies here.

extras.text: This small potion has chunks of fresh herbs and plants floating all about it. It is a mostly dark liquid which emits an incredible scent from the strong leaves it is made from.

objects.ground: A small leaf filled with a white powder lies here blowing on the ground.

extras.text: The soft powder located inside this large leaf gives off an awful stench. Although the white color gives it a welcoming look, this powder can only do harm if ingested.

objects.ground: A large oak cabinet stands along the western wall.

extras.text: This large cabinet is full of small drawers and compartments.  The small lock located directly in the middle is the only protection to the mysterious potions that lie within.

objects.ground: A small vial of clear liquid lies here on the ground.

extras.text: This old glass vial contains a small amount of crystal clear liquid.  The thick glass that surrounds the liquid could handle a drop or two if it was put to test.

objects.ground: An old blue vial lies here on the ground.

extras.text: This small vial contains a murky blue potion.  It starts to bubble as you move it around, showing that it has quite a high potency for its size.

objects.ground: An incredibly thick piece of wood lies here.

extras.text: This immaculate shield is full of engravings and pictures which appear all over both sides of it.  Although it looks to have taken some blows over the years, this shield is in near perfect condition.  On the inside of the shield near the bottom, Injoni Rif, is burnt into the wood, proving him as the original owner.

objects.ground: A long shiny broadsword lies here.

extras.text: This enormous steel sword gleams brightly as you look down upon it.  Its incredibly long and sharp blade is ready to cut through anything that comes in its way.

objects.ground: A piece of folded parchment lies here on the table.

extras.text: After unfolding the old paper, a small map of the Eastern wing of the Reservation presents itself to you.  You can see a small path leading up to some secret level, that can be reached through what looks like a trapdoor. The key below the map is completely worn away, leaving no clue as to what rooms lead where.

objects.ground: A piece of thick red meat lies here on the ground.

extras.text: This juicy piece of red meat has been grilled to perfection by the fat Frakati chef.  The sheer size of the meat shows the Frakati's incredible appetite, and the juices flowing off of it urge all who receive a piece to swallow it whole.

objects.ground: A dark piece of cloth lies here on the ground.

extras.text: This thick dark piece of cloth is comprised more of magic than anything else, and glows so bright it lights up everything around it.  This thick cloak should suit its bearer quite well in a fight of magic.

triggers.name: Load_Guard
triggers.commands: if %actor.align% < -349 wait 2 wecho A giant guard pops out from behind the coffin. wat 8423 wteleport frakatiguard 8363 end if

triggers.name: Random_mob_generate
triggers.commands: roar wait 2 em yells out for a guard to assist him. mload mob 8300

triggers.name: Give_pork
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.align% > 349 mload obj 8350 say Eat up while it's still hot. wait 1s give pork %actor.name% mforce %actor.name% eat pork endif endif

triggers.name: Frakati guard blocker
triggers.commands: * This is a general trigger for mobiles guarding certain exits. * To use it, make a copy of the trigger, and modify these two variables. * Then apply the trigger to the room beyond the guard. set entryroom 8352 set guardvnum 8332 if %get.mob_count[%guardvnum%]% && %actor.room% == %entryroom% && %actor.vnum% == -1 set blocked 0 set person %self.people% while %person% if %person.vnum% == %guardvnum% set guard %person% if %guard.position% /= Standing || %guard.position% /= Fighting || %guard.position% /= Flying set blocked 1 end end set person %person.next_in_room% done if %blocked% if %actor.level% < 100 set entrydir %get.opposite_dir[%direction%]% wat %actor.room% wechoaround %actor% %guard.name% blocks %actor.name% as %actor.heshe% tries to go %entrydir%. wat %actor.room% wsend %actor% %guard.name% steps purposefully into your way. return 0 else wat %actor.room% wechoaround %actor% %guard.name% makes no move as %actor.name% passes. return 1 end else return 1 end else return 1 end

rooms.name: A Path leading to an Enormous Forest
rooms.description: As you start your trek along this old path, you begin to see small animals peering at you through the brush.  This path has not been used much lately and is beginning to show signs of it.  There are small plants popping up through the dirt road, and some of nearby trees now overhang onto the path.  As you look down through the path, all you can see is more forest.  The trail continues on to the north, or you may venture south.

rooms.name: A Path leading to an Enormous Forest
rooms.description: A number of large green shrubs are located along both sides of this narrow path.  The plants and flowers here are incredibly green and look as if they receive plenty of rain.  The faint sound of water dropping from trees into small puddles can be heard all around you.  The small path continues onto the north, and diminishes with every step, or the start of the path can be reached directly south.

rooms.name: A Path leading to an Enormous Forest
rooms.description: The large trees that surround you give this area a sudden cool.  Small shrubs are now covering the path, making it difficult to pass through.  This area is engulfed in complete silence, with the occasional breaking of branches or cracking of nuts.  The forest that surrounds you is very dense, and would make for a great spot to hunt.  The thick path continues onward to the north, or you may head south towards the beginning of the path.

rooms.name: A Path leading to an Enormous Forest
rooms.description: With every step down this winding path, your view decreases more and more. High above the trees and bushes that surround you, enormous trees can be seen off in the distance.  Water dripping down from a nearby tree echos all around you.  The plants now growing on this path provide for a comfortable walking surface, but are beginning to make the trek difficult.  The overgrown path continues further on in the north direction, or you can make your way towards the beginning of the path to the south.

rooms.name: A Path leading to an Enormous Forest
rooms.description: Your line of vision is now completely gone, making this path more and more difficult to continue traveling upon.  The fresh land here would make for excellent hunting grounds, although there doesn't seem to be many animals living in these parts.  The faint smell of smoke from a fire lingers in the breeze, making you wonder where this path actually leads.  The rough path continues on to the east, or you can make your way back into less dense woods to the south.

rooms.name: A Path leading to an Enormous Forest
rooms.description: As you turn the corner, you are now staring directly at the largest sign you have ever seen.  It is hung on a large oak tree that has been here for centuries.  This sign was obviously placed here to give information to all those wishing to continue along this path.  The forest continues to thicken in this part of the path, almost making it difficult to read the large sign.  The path continues to forge its way through the forest to the east, or you may head west towards the entrance to the forest.

rooms.name: A Path leading to an Enormous Forest
rooms.description: Although you are still on the same path as you previously were, you now know where this path leads.  There are some small trees growing into the path and you must duck to get by them.  The ground here has become increasingly soft, making more comfortable on your legs and feet.  The trees around you block all further exploration except to the east, or you may head west where the forest begins to thin itself out.

rooms.name: A Path leading to an Enormous Forest
rooms.description: The plants and brush have now completely overgrown onto this path, again showing that it has not been used in quite some time.  The forest ahead of you is as fresh and green as they come.  The trees stretch over a hundred feet tall and you cannot tell how deep it goes.  If you look closely, it almost seems that there is a defense line set up right before the first group of large trees, in case a defensive stand must be made.  Large trees block your path to the north and south, and the path continues on in the eastern direction, or you can head away from the forest to the west.

rooms.name: The End of the Path
rooms.description: The path comes to a complete stop here.  The plants and trees have completely overgrown, forming a natural blockade in all directions.  Just behind the hedges you can see inside the enormous forest.  There are large oak trees that stretch over a hundred feet tall, and what appears to be a couple small huts are set up throughout the area.  The only exit from here is to head back on the path you came from, for large trees block the north and east directions, and an almost fake looking bush blocks your path to the south.

rooms.name: A Small Hidden Path
rooms.description: An ear-deafening silence has set in here, almost too still for comfort in these strange woodlands.  The canopy is structured here, almost looking man-made.  Branches seem to support some kind of edifices far above, their shadows cast down upon your current position.  Smoke rises in the sky somewhere to the north, carrying with it the distinctive scent of pork.  These signs along with the faint sound of people talking assure that there is some kind of organized life in these woods.  The path continues onward to the east.

rooms.name: A Small Hidden Path
rooms.description: As you venture further into this cleared away area, you begin to see a large gate far to the east.  This territory has obviously been cleared by some kind of beings, and has been done so for an open fighting area.  The silence that surrounds you adds to the effect of standing in the open field not knowing who has traveled here.  This hidden path continues on to the east, or you can make your way into thicker woods to the north and south.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: As you approach what appears to be a large gate, three Frakati guards pop out of the bushes.  These men are equipped with small swords and are clearly here to defend their land.  As you look through the gate you can see some Frakati hunters searching for supper.  The large gate to the east is the only way into the reservation, but it appears to be locked.

rooms.name: Deep in the Woods
rooms.description: As you venture off north of the small path, you are surrounded by trees and large bushes.  The woods here are very thick, and there is no line of vision except towards the path to the south.  The smell of a campfire is lingering in the air, and you can here voices through the trees.  From here you can travel back onto the path to the south, and into deeper woods to the east.

rooms.name: Deep in the Woods
rooms.description: As you venture off south of the small path, you are surrounded by trees and large bushes.  The woods here are very thick, and there is no line of vision except towards the path to the south.  The smell of a campfire is lingering in the air, and you can here voices through the tree's.  From here you can travel back onto the path to the north, and into deeper woods to the east.

rooms.name: Approaching a Large Gate
rooms.description: As you make your way along this small path, you begin to see what appears to be a large gate directly to the east.  It appears to be blocking the entrance to some sort of sacred land.  Freshly cut trees can be seen lying on the ground, showing signs of recent activity in the area.  The smell of freshly cooked meat lingers in the air, ensuring you that there is some sort of town around this area.

rooms.name: Deep in the Woods
rooms.description: As you venture off north of the small path, you are surrounded by trees and large bushes.  The woods here are very thick, and there is no line of vision except towards the path to the south.  The smell of a campfire is lingering in the air, and you can here voices through the trees.  From here you can travel back onto the path to the south, and into deeper woods to the west.

rooms.name: Deep in the Woods
rooms.description: As you venture off south of the small path, you are surrounded by trees and large bushes.  The woods here are very thick, and there is no line of vision except towards the path to the south.  The smell of a campfire is lingering in the air, and you can here voices through the trees.  From here you can travel back onto the path to the north, and into deeper woods to the west.

rooms.name: In the Frakati Hunting Grounds
rooms.description: As you step through the large gates, the crackling of your feet upon the ground echo through the woods.  All around you can hear the whispering of what sounds like men, attempting to catch a good meal.  This area must be the hunting grounds for the Frakati.  Although you cannot see any animals, you can hear twigs breaking all around you.  You can venture forth into the grounds to the south and east.

rooms.name: A Narrow Passageway
rooms.description: As you break through the last of the forest and out of the hunting grounds, you find yourself in a small passageway.  The woods here are much thinner and you can see the area around you.  To the north you can see what seems to be a large structured village of some sort.  There are large vines linking the higher level to the lower level, and it appears to be quite steady.  The Frakati hunting grounds lie to the south, and you can venture further into the village to the north.

rooms.name: In the Frakati Hunting Grounds
rooms.description: Through the braches and leaves, you stumble across the middle of what appears to be a large kill area.  The bushes and grubs here have been cut down and arranged such that to force the small animals down a small straight-away, leading to a spear ready hunter.  All around you are the small footprints of animals, with what appears to be small human footprints right behind them. Although these woods favor the prey highly, there is no where to hide from an overly hungry Frakati.  From here, you can venture further into the woods to the east and south.

rooms.name: In the Frakati Hunting Grounds
rooms.description: A large deer runs by as you enter the corner of this small hunting area. You hear the sound of an arrow sticking into the ground as you make your way through the dense forest.  The woods here is very thick, making it very difficult to look around you.  The hunters here must be very skillful to manage a kill in this thick reservation.  The hunting grounds continue to the north and east.

rooms.name: In the Frakati Hunting Grounds
rooms.description: The thick forest comes to a sudden stop, due to a large ravine directly to the south.  The wind whistles through the tree's as hunters move about totally undetected by their targets.  Small footprints in the dirt give signs that this land has been used quite recently . The eerie silence that engulfs this land provides for the perfect area to suit up and hunt for a nice supper.

rooms.name: In the Frakati Hunting Grounds
rooms.description: The hunting grounds seem to come to an unexpected end here.  A steep ravine is located directly to the south, and probably has been the benefactor to many an accident throughout its time.  The large green bushes that are scattered about these parts gives the impression that this land has been treated with care.  Small droplets of water fall from a tree into a small puddle, giving the only sound to this otherwise quiet part of the forest.

rooms.name: In the Frakati Hunting Grounds
rooms.description: With every step, the woods become more and more quiet.  The large green trees located here have endured many a cold winter in these parts, but show no signs of withering away any time soon.  Huge oak trees block your path to what appears to be to be a small town in and on the trees.  You can venture further into the woods to the north and west.

rooms.name: In the middle of the Frakati Hunting Grounds
rooms.description: The leaves breaking below your feet give rise of total silence.  All around you small eyes and dark shadows can be seen.  These hunting grounds have been used for quite some time, and the animals here have become accustomed with the hunters.  Large shrubs provide excellent hiding spots for deer and other animals, while the smaller squirrels and rabbits hide in underground burrows. The sound of excited voices can be heard in the distance to the north, you can venture further into the grounds in all directions.

rooms.name: In the Frakati Hunting Grounds
rooms.description: As you make your way through a thick group of trees, the ground almost falls out from under you.  A large ravine directly to the south of you blocks your path, and makes for an end to this small hunting area.  A small ray of light shines down through the thick foliage above you, and through it you can see small puffs of smoke rising from the northern direction.

rooms.name: A Narrow Passageway
rooms.description: As you break through the last of the forest and out of the hunting grounds, you find yourself in a small passageway.  The woods here are much thinner and you can see the area around you.  To the north you can see what seems to be a large structured village of some sort.  There are large vines linking the higher level to the lower level, and it appears to be quite steady.  The Frakati hunting grounds lie to the south, and you can venture further into the village to the north.

rooms.name: In the Frakati Hunting Grounds
rooms.description: As you dodge in and out of the thick woods, you come across an enormous set of oak trees.  These trees are barring your path to the east, and negates all light coming from the eastern direction.  The trees, combined with the canopy above, provide for quite an enclosed little area.  The air here is very thick and humid, showing signs that this area is slowly becoming more of a rain forest, than your normal woods.

rooms.name: Inside the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: As you step into the sacred Frakati reservation, you instantly smell fresh meat cooking on a large, blazing fire.  The small reservation is made entirely with, and in the trees.  In the south-eastern part of this room there is an enormous tree, which acts as a support to this multi-level reservation.  There are tightly wrapped vines laced through and around the tree which steady the large wooden platforms, that comprise the second level of this village.  To the north you can venture further into the reservation, or you may travel south back towards the hunting grounds.

rooms.name: Inside the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: You walk through the narrow passageway and you find yourself inside a large multi-level reservation.  The thickest vines you've ever seen are twisted and tied all around the trees above you, connecting large bridges and platforms which make up the second level of this village.  The squeaky voices you hear coming from all around are those of the Frakati, who have made this suspended fortress their home.  From here you can travel west, north, or east further into the reservation.

rooms.name: Along a steep cliff
rooms.description: The forest makes a sudden end here, and a large cliff directly to the west ensures that it will not manifest its way in that direction.  A large tree stands in the southwest edge of the cliff, used as one of the main supports for the second level of this village.  A small path through a large patch of bushes gives headway to the north, or you can make your way back towards the entrance to the east.

rooms.name: A Small stone path in the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The small path you were walking on has now become a semi-smooth flat rock surface.  Small engravings on the enormous trees to the north catch your eyes as you stroll by.  The forest here has thinned out quite a bit, and is almost non-existant in the western direction.  From here you may travel west into the village plaza, or south along a steep cliff.

extras.text: Inside this Tree rests the great Injoni Rif May this God among men R.I.P.

rooms.name: A Small Path in the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The soft path below your feet makes traveling this amazing area very comfortable.  Small voices can be heard coming from the west as you make your way through the vines and bushes.  The smooth path below your feet shows signs that it has been used for quite some time, and judging by the complexity of this village, it will be used for many years to come.  A wall of large oak trees to the north blocks all travel in that direction, you can travel further down the path to the west and east.

rooms.name: A Small Path in the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: As you travel deeper into this ancient civilization you notice that the canopy above is very low, giving hints that this Frakati Reservation has not been disturbed by any outsiders for quite some time.  The small path you are walking on is made of incredibly rich and fertile soil, making travel very relaxing.  To the north you can travel into the Frakati Farmland, or you can head east into the Southeast tower.

rooms.name: The Southeast Tower of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: As you duck under the covering to this small tower you are splashed by the dampness of the surroundings.  Being almost completely surrounded by vines and trees, the wet air makes this tower feel like a underground cave.  A faint light in the corner of the room radiates just enough for you to notice that the weaving done to support the second level of this city was done with amazing precision.  A large ladder leads up to the second level of the tower, or you can travel west towards the center of the village.

rooms.name: The Frakati Farmland
rooms.description: As you make your way through the trees, you are blinded by the sun coming down through the canopy above.  The large oak and spruce trees above have grown around an almost invisible area in the sky, thus giving the suns rays room to shine down upon the ground below.  This has created a perfect area for growing all the fruits and vegetables neccessary for the Frakatis to survive.  To the north and west the small farm continues, and to the south is the corner of the reservation.

rooms.name: The Frakati Farmland
rooms.description: Large corn stalks cover this small section of the Frakati Farm.  As you look around you can see small bridges and platforms connecting the second level of this town.  There are farmers about the area hustling to get their seeds planted for the coming season , and you can hear laborers planning the layout for the crops.  The forest to the east has overgrown blocking your path of travel in that direction, you can travel further into the farm to the east and north, the lack of trees here prevent travel up to the second level of the reservation.

rooms.name: The Frakati Farmland
rooms.description: As you make your way into this northern part of the Farmland, you come across a large patch of tomatoes.  The sound of a waterfall can be here coming from the western direction, which is blocked off by large oak trees.  The fresh smell of a nice warm meal lingers here in the air, and the fresh vegetables lying on the ground appear to be a suitable supplement.  To the north you can travel towards a large wall of trees, or you may travel east and south further into the Frakati farmland.

rooms.name: The Frakati Farmland
rooms.description: This northern section in the Frakati Farmland is full of potatoes and fresh lettuce.  The land here is very rugged, and the Frakati had to import soil from neighboring lands to grow the freshest vegetables they can.  The light coming down from above makes your eyes squint as you look around at this beautiful city.  There are large vines going up, down, and around the trees supporting the second level.  From here you can travel north into the tower, or west and south further into the Frakati farmland.

rooms.name: The Northeast Tower of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: As you duck under the covering to this small tower you are splashed by the dampness of the room.  Being almost completely surrounded by vines and trees, the wet air makes this tower feel like a underground cave.  A faint light in the corner of the room radiates just enough for you to notice that the weaving done to support the second level of this city was done with amazing precision. A large ladder leads up to the second level of the tower, or you can travel west towards the center of the village.

rooms.name: On the Edge of the Forest
rooms.description: This small path is mainly used by the Frakati for traveling and carrying food from the farm to the marketplace.  Along the northern edge of this path is a large set of oak trees that stretch as high as you can see.  This wall is about the only guard against the feared orcs that can easily take out the Frakatis due to their sheer size.  From here you can travel west towards the center of the city, or east into the guard tower.

rooms.name: On the Edge of the Forest
rooms.description: As you make your way down the path you hear the sound of a large waterfall coming somewhere from the south.  The view to the south is blocked off by large shrubs and trees, which appear to have been grow there intentionally to block travel in that direction.  All along the northern wall are engravings and portraits of past soldiers who have served the Frakati well during battles with the Orcs.  To the west you can make your way further down the path, or east back towards the Northeastern tower.

rooms.name: A Small stone path in the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The sweet smell of food lures you west as you make your way down the dirt path.  Frakati villagers can be heard talking in the distance to the west, to go along with the delicious smell.  The large wall of trees to the north, along with the large shrubs and bushes to the south, give you no other choice but to travel along the dirt path to the west or east.

rooms.name: The Village Plaza
rooms.description: A cool breeze blows from the southerly direction as you make your way into the center of the reservation.  The path you were traveling upon has now become a layer of smooth stones which gives this part of the reservation a different feel.  The large wall of trees continues to block your path to the north, from here you may travel south to the heart of the Reservation, or west further along the village plaza.

rooms.name: The Heart of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: Stepping onto this large stone plaza shows how skillful the Frakati really are.  This area has been almost completely cleared of trees and bushes save for a few used to connect up to the second level of the village.  People run all around you as you take a second to admire the most beautiful part of this reservation.  Heat coming from a large fire in the southwest corner of the plaza give this part of the village a nice, warm feel.  Due to the lack of trees here, travel up is impossible, but you may venture further into the Heart of the Reservation to the south and west.

rooms.name: The Heart of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: Stepping onto this large stone plaza shows how skillful the Frakati really are.  This area has been almost completely cleared of trees and bushes save for a few used to connect up to the second level of the village.  People run all around you as you take a second to admire the most beautiful part of this reservation.  Heat coming from a large fire in the southeast corner of the plaza give this part of the village a nice, warm feel.  Due to the lack of trees, travel up is impossible, but you can venture further into the Heart of the Reservation to the south and east.

rooms.name: The Heart of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: A large open fire blazes brightly with fresh chunks of meat slowly cooking to perfection in this Frakati eating area.  An enormous wooden table dominates this hungry man's heaven.  The fat Frakati chef stands here happily cooking up the best pork roast you could ever imagine.  There are scraps of food all over the ground and on the table, and there are townspeople coming in and out getting dinner for their family.  Due to the lack of trees here, travel up is not possible, but you may venture further into the Heart of the Reservation to the north and east.

rooms.name: The Heart of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: Stepping onto this large stone plaza shows how skillful the Frakati really are.  This area has been almost completely cleared of trees and bushes save for a few used to connect up to the second level of the village.  People run all around you as you take a second to admire the most beautiful part of this reservation.  Heat coming from a large fire in the northwest corner of the plaza give this part of the village a nice, warm feel.  Due to the lack of trees here, travel up is impossible, but you may venture north and west further into the Heart of the Reservation.

rooms.name: The Village Plaza
rooms.description: As the small path ends, you find yourself in the small town plaza which surrounds the heart of the reservation.  There are very few trees here, and the Frakati have used large slabs of jet black slate to create a beautiful, scenic center of their small world.  A large oak platform is suspended fifteen feet directly above you by strong vines and ropes.  The heart of the reservation lies directly north, or you can venture west further into the plaza.

rooms.name: The Village Plaza
rooms.description: The powerful smell of freshly cooked meat blows in from the north, as you travel into the plaza.  The fierce looking reservation warriors running around these parts of the village give this plaza a feeling of safety from any evil outsiders who could have found there way in.  The area here and to the east have been cleared out quite a bit to provide room for large slate plaza below you.  From here you may travel north into the heart of the city, west to the main path.

rooms.name: The Main Path in the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: Broken branches and crushed stone give hints that you have stepped onto the main path used by the Frakati . Mostly traveled upon to get to the heart of the reservation for meals, this path has taken quite a beating from overly hungry warriors and townspeople.  A large oak platform is suspended fifteen feet directly above you by strong vines and ropes.  The path continues here to the east and west.

rooms.name: The Main path in the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The Frakati Reservation is a very peaceful and calm village as long as you are away from the center of town.  The dense woods you travel in now are a pleasure from out of control food area.  The soft dirt path you are now traveling on makes for comfortable traveling, and the large wooden platform above you cools the area with a relaxing shade.  From here you may travel west towards the Frakati sleeping quarters, or east towards the center of the reservation.

rooms.name: The Main Path in the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The end of the small path leads directly to the entrance of the sleeping quarters.  The door to the north is accompanied by a large guard, ready to defend his resting warriors.  The large guard tower to the west ensures that if an attack occured in this part of the reservation, the attacker would be taken care of swiftly.  From here you may travel north into the sleeping quarters, or west into the guard tower.

rooms.name: The Southwest Tower of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: As you duck under the covering to this small tower you are splashed by the dampness of the room.  Being almost completely surrounded by vines and trees, the wet air makes this tower feel like a underground cave.  A faint light in the corner of the room radiates just enough for you to notice that the weaving done to support the second level of this city was done with amazing precision. A large ladder leads up to the second level of the tower, or you can travel east towards the center of the village.

rooms.name: On the Edge of the Forest
rooms.description: As you make your way through the thick woods, a very steep ravine to the west almost sucks you in.  The forest has made all attempts to expand its territory in that direction, but have made no progress.  The lower and upper levels of the Frakati sleeping quarters can be seen in the eastern direction. A thick oak platform fifteen feet above you provides a comfortable shade in this section of the forest.  From here you may travel south to the guard tower, or north further along the path.

rooms.name: The Frakati Sleeping Quarters
rooms.description: Stepping through the small door brings you into the first sheltered area you've seen in the reservation.  Rows and rows of small beds lie here on the ground.  The surface itself is made of soft, thick leaves on top of an oak wooden frame.  There are a few sick townspeople lying down here, but most are out building and assisting in the preservation of the reservation.  To the north lies the hunter's sleeping quarters, and you may travel up to the second level of the quarters.

rooms.name: The Hunters Sleeping Quarters
rooms.description: Strong oak beds are lined up here all around the outside of this room.  A small fire blazed in the middle to ensure all hunters a nice warm night of sleep.  The weapons and clothes of these sly scavangers rest on the bedpost at the end of their bed, along with training equipment for the scouts.  The warrior's quarters are directly up, or you can head south towards the entrance of the sleeping grounds.

rooms.name: On the Edge of the Forest
rooms.description: Coming to an abrupt end here, the forest is segregated from the rest of the landscape by a steep-sloped ravine, carved out in the shape of a crescent. The canopy is thin here, allowing you to peek at the sky for the first time in awhile.  The trees have made attempts at cultivating the rocky climb, but to no progress.  They must learn to be content with the small sanctuary in which they inhabit, as it is surely the only one of its kind.  From here you may travel north to the into the guard tower, or south along the steep ravine.

rooms.name: The Northwest Tower of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: As you duck under the covering to this small tower you are splashed by the dampness of the surroundings.  Being almost completely surrounded by vines and trees, the wet air makes this tower feel like a underground cave.  A faint light in the corner of the room radiates just enough for you to notice that the weaving done to support the second level of this city was done with amazing precision.  A large ladder leads up to the second level of the tower, or you can travel east towards the center of the village.

rooms.name: The Northern Path
rooms.description: The forest here begins to thin out again as you make your way towards the northwest guard tower.  A small patch of mushrooms have started to grow in the shade of the large wall to the north, their beautiful colors invite you to pick them all up at once.  The northwest tower can be reached directly west, or you can head east towards the center of the village.

rooms.name: The Northern Path
rooms.description: Soft brown dirt brings back the deep forest feel as you travel along this small path.  Rarely used in comparison to the main path further south, this quiet green path gives this reservation a very peaceful feeling.  The enormous defensive wall to the north continues to blockade all travel in that direction. The path continues on to the west or you can venture east down the path towards the heart of the reservation.

rooms.name: A Small Stone Path in the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The trees and shrubs along this path have thickened yet again, making the center of this reservation seem a long way in the distance.  The flat rock surface which is the only path of travel in this part of the reservation, is old and wearing down.  Large thick bushes block your path to the south, and the wall to the north continues to rise.  The path continues in the western direction, or you can make your way east back towards the heart of the reservation.

rooms.name: The Village Plaza
rooms.description: The large defensive wall to the north soars high over head as you enter this northern part of the plaza.  Bright green grass and the first open areas you've seen in this part of the reservation beckon you to take a rest and relax. Large jet slabs create the smooth walking surface below your feet.  The heart of the city can be reached to the south, or you can travel back into the woods to the west.

rooms.name: Inside the enormous Oak Tree
rooms.description: A large wooden coffin dominates this sanctuary to the first Frakati chief. Intricate engravings and words in a foreign language adorn the large, polished oak coffin.  These writings lead up to the a large name stated near the bottom of the casket.  Injoni Rif, the first of the Frakati, rests inside this small tomb in eternal peacefulness.  A small candle burning above the casket continuously blazes all day, and all night, symbolizing the Frakati's existance in this realm as everlasting.

rooms.name: The Observation Deck
rooms.description: The wood below you creaks as you step onto its old but sturdy planks.  The red paint in the middle of this platform has worn out, telling you that this deck has been used for quite some time.  The entrance to the Reservation can be seen through the canopy down and to the south of you, which could give an excellent warning if trouble were to penetrate the gate guards.  The deck continues to the east, or you can make your way north onto the main platform.

rooms.name: The Observation Deck
rooms.description: The small but stable platform which supports you has been made of flat boards, dyed with green and brown colors.  This not only provides good camouflage from lost travelers, but the red surface on top ensures that you will not fall from this overhanging section of the reservation.  Only the keenest of eyes can see the skillful Frakati hunters hard at work, tracking down dinner for this evenings feast.  The deck continues to the east and west, or you can make your way north onto the main platform.

rooms.name: The Observation Deck
rooms.description: The huge trees along with the never-ending forest give this observation deck quite the look.  To the south and east, the forest expands itself as far as it allows you to see, and small animals can be heard running through the bushes. The small deck continues to the west, or you can make your way onto the main platform located to the north.

rooms.name: The Southeast Tower of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: This second tier of the tower is laced over and over with vines, used to support the main platform of this second level of the reservation.  There are small holes pushed through the large tree that makes up this important tower. A small ray of light shines through a crack in the ceiling above you.  There are decent sized rocks here, apparantely used to throw down through the holes, to take out any would be attackers.  From here you can explore the second level of this reservation to the north and west.

rooms.name: On the main platform
rooms.description: Strong planks are wrapped and fastened to the main platform and from the weaker one which is used over the Frakati farmland.  There is no red dye on the wood here, which makes it easier to see where the two decks are interlocked. The sturdy over look to the south gives a perfect view of the surrounding land to the south.  The oak platform below you offers travel to the east and west.

rooms.name: On a narrow platform
rooms.description: The dark red dye which colors the platform below you is beginning to fade away here.  The wet looking wood underneath was apparantely set in a liquid sealer used to add strength and life to the wood.  Judging by the age of this reservation, it did an incredible job, but now the wood is beginning to weaken slowly with age.  The small deck continues to the north and east, or you can head south onto the main platform.

rooms.name: On a narrow platform
rooms.description: This small wooden platform is held up by thick vines that stretch out between the two towers on this side of the reservation.  Mainly used for communication among the soldiers, this part of the second level is much smaller than the rest.  The extra room for sunlight and heat, allows the farmland below to grow naturally and peacefully.  The Southeast tower lies directly to the south, and you can venture further along the small platform to the north and west.

rooms.name: On a narrow platform
rooms.description: The thin handrail along the eastern part of the platform provides limited balance on the unstable deck below you.  The small spaces between the wooden planks allow you to see an old farmer hard at work down below.  Extra room for sunlight provided for by the narrow platform allows the farmland below to grow at will.  The Northeast tower can be reached to the north, or you may travel along the weak platform to the south and west.

rooms.name: On a narrow platform
rooms.description: Mostly sturdy planks provided for by the large tree to the west give a feeling of safety as you look around.  Large vines and rope are used here to fasten the small boards which are enlarged about a foot into the tree.  The constant splash from a waterfall can be heard from the western direction.  The small platform continues to the south and east, or you can head north towards a large wall of trees.

rooms.name: The Northeast tower of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: This second tier of the tower is laced over and over with vines, used to support the main platform of this second level of the reservation.  There are small holes pushed through the large tree that makes up this important tower. There are decent sized rocks here, apparantely used to throw down through the holes, to take out any would be attackers.  The tower continues up, or you can explore the second level of this reservation to the south and west.

rooms.name: Along the northern wall
rooms.description: Solid oak wood creates a very safe and comfortable deck below you.  The thick wall of trees to the north, with various holes in it, not only provides a strong defensive fron, but gives a chance of long range attack with stones or arrows.  The large Northeast tower is directly east, or you can venture further along this deck to the west and south.

rooms.name: Along the Northern Wall
rooms.description: Large oak trees to the north and south give this quiet room a hallway like feel.  The faint smell of roasted pork lingers in from the west as the wind softly blows around you.  A sturdy wooden shelf along the northern wall holds countless rocks, ready to be used as weapons against any would be attackers, at any time.  The solid oak platform beneath you offers travel to the east and west.

rooms.name: The Entrance to the Armor Shop
rooms.description: The fresh smell of hardened leather blows in from the south as you make your way further along the northern wall.  A large tree to the south has miracuously lives on even though a small room, apparantly an armor shop, has been carved right into it.  The thick wall to the north continues to dominate all travel in that direction.  The large oak platform continues on to the east and west, or you can travel south into the armor shop.

rooms.name: Overlooking the Heart of the Reservation
rooms.description: The small holes in the northern wall continue to show their presence as you travel along this sturdy main platform.  The forest to the south has been cleared out almost completely, with the heart of the reservation showings off its beautiful stone plaza below.  The large wall of trees to the north provides a defiant front to all those wishing to attack from that direction.  The large oak platform continues to the east and west.

rooms.name: Overlooking the Heart of the Reservation
rooms.description: The forest here has been cleared out almost completely in the southern direction, giving an incredible view of the Heart of the Reservation.  The mouth watering smell of pork cooking on a hot fire rises up from the village center below.  The large chef can be seen handing out large plates of meat to hungry villagers.  The large oak platform gives headway to the east and west.

rooms.name: The Weapon Supply Shop
rooms.description: Shiny steel and sharp daggers adorn the walls and floor of this Frakati weapons shop.  An aged Frakati warrior stands along the back wall regripping a small axe for one of the young scouts.  Large stones resting on the weaponsmith's table are used as files to give the weapons a general shape, and a large emerald is used by the weaponsmith to give them their deadly tips. The only exit out of this shop is to head north onto the main platform.

rooms.name: The Medicine Man's Hut
rooms.description: Strong herbs signal your nose that you've reached the Frakati's medicine man.  A large bureau stands locked up against the northern wall, surely full of valuable herbs and powders.  The old medicine man stands directly in back of his table, and apparantely has some small potions inside his many pockets. The only exit to this strange shop is south, back onto the main platform .

rooms.name: The Armor Supply Shop
rooms.description: As you duck to make your way into this large tree, a small woman looks up from her table along the southern wall.  Breastplates and shields lie on the ground and against the trunk of the tree here.  Mainly made from the rough hide from buffalos, and the tough skin from a deadly orc, the Frakati armor is hard to penetrate by any steel or iron weapons.  The only exit to this armor shop is to the north.

rooms.name: The Magic Shop
rooms.description: Sudden darkness engulfs you as you step into the shamans magic hut.  Your eyes slowly adjust to the dim candle in the corner of the room which provides the only light in this cold shop.  The strange sorcerer himself stands in the corner of the room slowly and carefully reciting the words from a large black book resting on his small altar.  The shady man who runs this shop is the main reason why it is so rarely visited.  The only exit out of this creepy shop is south, back onto the main platform .

rooms.name: On the main platform
rooms.description: Secure wooden railings provide a safe guide along the oak platform that you now stand upon.  The faint sound of townspeople chatting can be heard coming from the western direction.  The red dye on the ground provides a much needed guide to oak platform which makes up the second level of this reservation. The solid platform continues to the east and west, and the observation deck can be reach to the south.

rooms.name: The Entrance to the Magic Shop
rooms.description: The voices of the townspeople fade away as you focus on the strange mantra coming from the northern direction.  The red dye on the oak wood appears untouched towards the magic shop to the north.  The strange shop of the town shaman is located to the north inside of a large oak tree, and the oak platform below you offers travel to the east and west.

rooms.name: Overlooking the Heart of the Reservation
rooms.description: Camouflage panels can be seen along the southern wall, used to deceive any lost traveler's eyes.  The forest has been cleared out quite a bit to the north, to provide plenty of open room at the center of the reservation.  The red dye on the floor here is half faded away, showing that even this seldom visited part of the second level is beginning to lose its fight with time. The oak platform continues on to the east and west.

rooms.name: Overlooking the Heart of the Reservation
rooms.description: The forest opens itself up to you as you reach the overlook of the Heart of the Reservation.  The large happy chef can be seen below handing out plates of freshly cooked pork.  In the distance to the north you can see the corresponding overlook, which is fastened to the northern wall with incredible use of the surrounding vines and branches . The solid oak platform continues on to the east and west.

rooms.name: The Entrance to the Medicine Shop
rooms.description: Warm air blowing around you blows in the smell of herbs and spiced coming from the northern direction.  That along with the musty smoke give signs that the medicine man is hard at work to the north.  The large oak tree to the north has been carved out to provide room for a small shop.  The oak platform beneath you offers further travel to the west and east.

rooms.name: On the main platform
rooms.description: This mostly quiet section of the reservation lets you look around and take in the true beauty of this reservation.  The large vines and planks which are used to secure the second deck have been laced together with skill and perplexity which are completely unparallel.  The strong oak platform blow you continues on to the east and west.

rooms.name: On the main platform
rooms.description: The wooden walkway is incredibly stable here, being closest to its support coming from the tower to the west.  A sturdy wall to the north also uses large planks to help steady this large wooden deck which comprises most of the second level of this reservation.  Bright rays of light which have somehow made it through the canopy above reflect off the red paint on top of the wooden platform.  To the west lies the tower, and the platform continues off to the east.

rooms.name: The Southwest Tower of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: This second tier of the tower is laced over and over with vines, used to support the main platform of this second level of the reservation.  There are small holes pushed through the large tree that makes up this important tower. There are decent sized rocks here, apparantely used to throw down through the holes, to take out any would be attackers.  The tower continues up, or you can explore the second level of this reservation to the north and east.

rooms.name: On a solid platform
rooms.description: Spare for the high-pitched whistling of the wind, this sturdy part of the second level is very quiet.  The faint sound of a Frakati snoring can be heard through the wall to the east.  The steep ravine down and to the west provides an incredible view of the surrounding land which appears to be too dangerous to explore.  The platform continues to the north, or the tower can be reached by venturing south.

rooms.name: The Womens Sleeping Quarters
rooms.description: A thick set of vines and cloth seperate the women's sleeping grounds from the rest of the surround rooms.  Soft blankets and thick liners provide the Frakati women with comfortable conditions to gather rest upon.  A weak candle lights up this otherwise dark room, and deal silence provides the right climate for a tired woman.  A small ladder located along the wall provides a route down, or you can travel north into the warriors sleeping quarters.

rooms.name: The Warriors Sleeping Quarters
rooms.description: Large beds to go along with wooden weapon racks identify this room as the warriors sleeping quarters.  A few tired guards lie here, resting up for their night shift to come around.  The walls here are made of dried mud and clay, imported from the neighboring lands.  They provide enough silence for the important soldiers to regain their energy after a long night.  From here you may travel down to the hunter's sleeping quarters, or south into the women's sleeping quarters.

rooms.name: On a solid platform
rooms.description: The wind blowing up from the steep ravine down and to the west almost knocks you off your feet as you travel onto this strong stretch of the second deck. A vast expanse of unexplored land surrounds the ravine which threatens to engulf all those who make their way into it.  The strong platform continues to the south, and the tower can be reached by traveling north.

rooms.name: The Northwest Tower of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: This second tier of the tower is laced over and over with vines, used to support the main platform of this second level of the reservation.  There are small holes pushed through the large tree that makes up this important tower. There are decent sized rocks here, apparantely used to throw down through the holes, to take out any would be attackers.  The tower continues up, or you can explore the second level of this reservation to the south and east.

rooms.name: On the main platform
rooms.description: The thick wall to the north gives an extra good feeling of closure from any would be accident that could occur while traveling on the second level of this reservation.  The fifteen feet in between the ground and this deck, would not be very leniant to anyone or anything who happnened to fall through or around the large platform below you.  The main deck continues to the east, or you can venture west into the tower.

rooms.name: On the main platform
rooms.description: A peaceful silence surrounds you as you travel into this calm section of the Frakati Reservation.  A beautiful but unexplorable part of the forest to the south provides you with a good view of the true skill of the Frakati.  From here you can see the countless vines that are strapped around the large oak platform which are tightly fastened to the large trees that surround it, giving you confidence in the plaform below you.  The strong deck continues on to the east and west.

rooms.name: The Entrance to the Weapon Shop
rooms.description: A consistent scraping noise from the south echos off the trees that surround you.  That piercing noise, along with the worn away dye on the ground, ensures that the Frakati warriors and hunters have done quite a bit of traveling into the weaponsmith's shop to the south.  The large platform continues to the east and west, or you can head into the large oak tree to the south.

rooms.name: The Hidden level of the Tower
rooms.description: As you travel up through the trapdoor you find yourself in the most highly decorated part of the Frakati reservation.  The oak floor below is no longer red, but a spectrum of colors which come together to complete a beautiful picture of of Frakati village.  A large lantern in the corner of the room gives plenty of light in this enclosed area, which appears to be most important part of this small town.  From here you may travel north and west further into this hidden masterpiece.

rooms.name: The Hidden level of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The chatting of the villagers hard at work no longer presents itself in this enclosed and very peaceful hall.  Guards softly whispering adds to the already safe environment which will remain that way if the well equipped guards walking around the area see any wrong doing.  The large oak walls to the south and west are filled with old paintings of past leaders, most of which were incredible warriors.  The beautiful hall continues to the north and east.

rooms.name: The Hidden hall in the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: A completely spotless floor adds to the beauty of this elegent hall.  The beautiful oak floor has been polished as much as its gel coated surface will allow, and gives off a feeling of power.  A soft candle burns along the western wall making the paintings which adorn it stand out of their frames.  The hall continues on to the east and north.

rooms.name: The Hidden hall in the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The cold air which blew around the lower levels of the reservation has been cut off as this enclosed hall provides a warm and serene environment.  The dark brown floor provides a smooth surface to walk on as you make your way around this large hall.  Small vines can be seen weaved into the boards which are used to support this platform against the trees on the other side.  The large hall continues on the the north and west.

rooms.name: The Hidden hall in the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The oak floor leads up to a highly decorated carpet which is completely spotless.  There are two old candles against the eastern wall which give off a delicious cinnamon scent.  The wooden ceiling rises at least ten feet above your head, making this ornate hall seem like a giant arena.  This warm hall has a moist climate, which is supremely caused by the damp wood which makes up the floor and walls that surround you.  The beautiful carpet continues to the north and west, offering travel in both directions.

rooms.name: The Hidden hall in the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The highly detailed carpet below you has been weaved into the most amazing timeline you have ever seen.  It depicts how Injoni Rif along with the help of the first Frakati escaped from the orc ruled lands and created salvation in the woodland you now find yourself in.  This otherwise dark room is lit by a large candle against the western wall, which provides just enough light in this large hallway.  The hall opens itself up for travel to the north, east, or south.

rooms.name: The Frakati Leader's Quarters
rooms.description: The amazingly soft carpet below you leads up to the living and sleeping quarters of the Frakati's sole leader.  His small bed rests against the northern wall, and a weaponstand is at the end of it, although it would take quite the warrior to get past all of the guards roaming the long hall leading here.  An enormous table stands in the middle of the room with all sorts of maps and scrolls on top of it.  The Frakati have been trying to locate any villages in the area who haven't fallen to the evil ways for quite some time. The ceiling here has risen a few extra feet to ensure a peaceful and spacious living area for the leader, who cannot travel the town in fear of a horrible attack.  The Leader's Quarters continue on to the east, or you can head south down the long hall.

rooms.name: The Frakati Leader's Quarters
rooms.description: The elegent yet relaxing room that opens up here gives you a feeling of complete serenity.  There are two small tables here, one filled with all sorts of fruits, vegetables, and meats, the other with wine and other delicious drinks suitable only for the most noble of the Frakati people.  A small hole in the ceiling provides a much needed escape for the smoke of a small fire which keeps this room nice and warm.  The soft carpet below you remains as clean as ever, and gives you a feeling of power and importance.  The Leader's Quarters continue on to the west, or you can head south down the long hall.

rooms.name: The Southeast Tower of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The distinct smell of old age greets you as you make your way up to the third level of the reservation.  The tower's ceiling can now be clearly seen for the first time, rising twenty feet above you.  This large structure would be easily identified as a man-made structure, even by orcs, were it not for the placement of the tower, which was cleverly built between two large trees, located to the south and west.  The third level expands off to the north and east, or you may travel down to the second level of the tower.

rooms.name: The top of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: This highest level of the Frakati reservation now soars among some of the smaller oak trees around the area.  Noisy birds can be heard all around in their nests, chirping a tune to ward off enemies.  The soft breeze that blows here brings with it the smell of paint, and the foul smell of old age.  A thin wall to the north completely blockades all travel in that direction.  The sturdy wooden platform below you offers travel to the east, or you may head west into the tower.

rooms.name: The Frakati Research Area
rooms.description: A large oak table sits in the middle of the room with papers and maps all over it.  This part of the open shop is the research room for the reservation itself, the surrounding land, and the possible nearby village location maps. Only two of the smartest Frakati have access to this part of the reservation, and hav ebeen personally chosen by the Frakati leader himself.  The threat of orcs finding this hidden reservation continually provides danger to the Frakati and most all of the research goes into ways of preventing this from happening. The large shop expands off to the north and east.

rooms.name: The top of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The strong gusts of wind blowing up from the west chill this open part of the third level.  The large ravine down below, and the surrounding treeless land provide enough room for the only wind in this reservation to create a breeze.  The view to the west expands well past the ravine and into a see of large oak and maple trees.
