The great abundance of old aged trees, which tower above all the neighboring trees, have surely been used to make the platform on which you now stand.  The tower can be entered directly to the south, or you may travel along the platform to the north.

rooms.name: The top of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: Now high above the land below, the ravine down and to the west looks like an enormous pit.  The view here expands way off through the forest to the west into an eternity of trees, giving this small village a very secluded feel. The wooden platform below, with its bright red dye coating it, is strongly supported by the towers to the north and a ways south.  From here you may continue travel north into the tower, or south along the wooden platform.

rooms.name: The Elder Frakati Paint Workshop
rooms.description: With no breeze at all blowing in this part of the workshop, the awful stench of the elder Frakati is unbearable.  The workers here were once rugged warriors or hardy cooks, but now being some of the oldest walking life forms you've ever seen, their tasteless smell off age and work gives this area an unbearable aroma.  The large table extends in here from the eastern direction, and small buckets of paint lie all over it.  The large shop expands to the east and south, offering easy travel in both directions.

rooms.name: The top of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The large wall of trees which make up the northern defensive front, comes to a stop about four feet from platform below you.  Large rocks and stones lie along the edge of the platform and the wall, ready to be heaved at any attacker coming from the north.  The long camouflage boards which make up most of the Frakati outside walls have been skillfully painted appear as if there is no wall there at all.  The platform below you continues east, or you may head west into the tower.

rooms.name: The Northwest Tower of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The dry and tasteless smell of old age sits thick in the air of the third level of the reservation.  The enormous vines used as a support to the main platform continues to dominate the walls and floor of this tower.  Huge trees to the north and west provide this high rising tower excellent cover from any lost traveler who could identify this as a man made structure.  The third level of the tower expands itself to the east and south.

rooms.name: The top of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The empty smell of old age continues to blow in from the eastern direction. This bitter stench makes the clean and cool scent of fresh-air given off by the forest, completely disappear.  A thin wall to the south deafens the soft voices which can be heard chatting on the other side.  The defensive wall to the north ends about four feet from the wooden platform below you, and offers a perfect view to any would be attacks from that direction.  The wooden platform below you expands to the east and west.

rooms.name: The top of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The third level of the reservation makes a dead stop here in the eastern direction, and a large hand rail provides a much need safety gate to all those traveling on this platform.  The forest opens up quite a bit to the east, and way off in the distance you can see a large wooded structure secluded from the rest of the reservation.  This seperate area is almost undetectable to all those who have not been raised in these woods, and the Frakati choose to keep it this way.  The wooden platform below you offers travel to the west and south.

rooms.name: The top of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: A sturdy railing along the eastern edge of the platform supplies all those wishing to look down upon the heart of the reservation a safe and sturdy aid. The most unique view here of this three level suspended city takes the breath away from all those who have gazed upon it.  The sheer complexity of the ropes and vines used to hold up the large platforms which create the top two levels of the reservation, are soley the work of a genius . The sturdy oak platform below you expands off to the north and south, or you may venture west into the elder work area.

rooms.name: The top of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: A calm breeze blows in from the east as you travel further along the wooden platform.  The beautiful heart of the reservation has wiped out almost all the trees in that direction, creating an unbelievable view.  The sun, which has somehow made its way down through the canopy, reflects off the large spring that provides all the Frakati with fresh drinking water.  The faint smell of pork rises from below and you can hear small conversations off to the west. The solid oak platform below you expands to the south and north, or you can travel west into the elder's work area.

rooms.name: The top of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The solid oak wooden platform ends completely in the eastern direction, but offers a new route of travel to the north.  The lack of trees east prevents the Frakati from expanding this top level of the reservation in that area.  The view to the south provides an endless mirage of trees, which extends as far out as it allowed you to see.  A strong railing to the east adds some safety to this somewhat dangerous part of the third level.  Way off to the east a small secluded structed remains hidden in between the two eastern towers.  The platform below you offers travel to the north and west.

rooms.name: The top of the Frakati Reservation
rooms.description: The red dye on the top of the wooden platform continues to guide you along this steady third level.  The dye here is almost completely untouched, giving hints that not very many Frakati travel this route during their everyday activities.  A thin wall to the north softens the conversation between two Frakati who are discussing something on the other side.  The solid oak platform below you offers travel to the east and west.

rooms.name: The Elder Frakati Clothes and Supply Shop
rooms.description: Large piles of cloth and fabric lie along the southern wall of the shop here.  The small outfits and shoes that lie on the wooden table in the center of the room gives signs that most of the clothes and attire the Frakati need to survive have been produced in this part of the reservation.  Small Frakati women work on in their old age to get as much of the villages clothes and supplies finished before the winter comes.  A circle of chairs around the wooden table are filled with Frakati hard at work sewing as fast as they can. The shop continues to the north and west, or you may travel east onto the sturdy wooden platform.

rooms.name: The Elder Frakati Paint Workshop
rooms.description: The epicenter of the foul smell has revealed itself as you venture into this paint workshop.  Elder Frakati hard at work here, have obviously been spending quite some time up on this third level to create such a grueling stench.  The large room you now stand in expands high above you, and off to the west and south, provding the elders here with ample room to work on their projects.  A large wooden table stretches down the center of the room and large planks that cover it have the makings of a camouflage coating covering them.  Small buckets of paint rest on the table ready to be put to use at any time.  The shop expands to the west and south, or you can travel east onto the main wooden platform.

rooms.name: Load room
rooms.description: Why are you here?
